schema.table: this is where a description goes

schema.date: 2 digit month / 2 digit day / 4 digit year

schema.scholarship: Boolean describing if a student has any scholarships for the upcoming semsester
schema.scholarship_amount: monetary value of all scholarships and grants added together

example.description: a new flavor of BYU Creamery Ice Cream

publisher_id.description: The ID connected to the publisher, found in the JWT. Guaranteed to be unique

event_body.description: this is the meat of the event, what actually changed. The EventHub does no policing about the event_body, but it should follow the schema found in the corresponding registered event_type

example.description: any events related to creamery ice cream

publisher_name.description: The Name of the publisher, retrieved from the JWT
Not guaranteed to be unique. Include either unique publisher_name or publisher_id

webhook_id.description: ID is generated by the EventHub when creating a new webhook. Make a webhook first, then use the ID to subscribe

event_body.description: this is the meat of the event, what actually changed. The EventHub does no policing about the event_body, but it should follow the schema found in the corresponding registered event_type

webhook_id.description: ID is generated by Webhook, returned after creation or query, and referenced when creating subscriptions

validation_information: honestly I don't know what this is for TODO
still don't know what this is for

cache.description: If data is from live source, value will be null, otherwise it will be date-time of cache

400.description: Invalid Request - unable to interpret request

409.description: Body of the request contains conflicting, malformed, or invalid data

info.title: AWS_EventHub
info.description: Node.js implementation of the C code, deployed using AWS.
